agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Human Services TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, April 9, 2019 PLACE: E2.030 CHAIR: Rep. James B. Frank HB 12 Davis, Sarah | et al. Relating to early childhood intervention and rehabilitative and habilitative services. HB 1110 Davis, Sarah | et al. Relating to the Medicaid eligibility of certain women after a pregnancy. HB 1613 Moody Relating to the provision of recovery community organization services under Medicaid. HB 1682 Raney | et al. Relating to collection and use of child safety data for licensed day-care centers. HB 1780 Miller | et al. Relating to the mandatory dismissal date of certain suits affecting the parent-child relationship involving the Department of Family and Protective Services. HB 1884 Minjarez Relating to the information provided to relative and other designated caregivers of children in the conservatorship of the Department of Family and Protective Services. HB 2062 Guerra Relating to the provision and reimbursement of home telemonitoring services under Medicaid. HB 2333 Paddie Relating to the Texas ambulance response safety net program; imposing a mandatory payment; authorizing an administrative penalty. HB 2392 Klick Relating to applicants for employment at assisted living facilities. HB 2409 Klick Relating to establishing supplemental payment programs for the reimbursement of certain ambulance providers under Medicaid. HB 2786 Button | et al. Relating to employee turnover reporting during a child-care facility's or registered family home's license renewal. HB 3111 Klick | et al. Relating to student loan repayment assistance for certain nurses employed by a long-term care facility. HB 3117 Schaefer Relating to developing the proposed plan on long-term care for persons with an intellectual disability participating in the home and community-based waiver program. HB 3192 Hinojosa Relating to standards for expulsion policies of certain child-care facilities. HB 3286 Sheffield Relating to Medicaid reimbursement for medication-assisted treatment for opioid or substance use disorder. HB 3389 Sanford | et al. Relating to creating a position of nonprofit agency services coordinator for the Department of Family and Protective Services. HB 3390 Sanford Relating to a voluntary temporary caregiver program providing temporary care for children removed from their homes. HB 3659 Turner, Chris Relating to liability insurance requirements for certain child-care providers. HB 3738 Goldman Relating to creating an Internet website of certain day-care providers and parenting resources. HB 3803 Guillen Relating to administrative penalties for certain long-term care facilities. HB 4178 Frank Relating to the operation and administration of certain health and human services programs, including the Medicaid managed care program. HB 4259 Bonnen, Greg Relating to the regulation of listed family homes. HB 4261 Bonnen, Greg Relating to the regulation of child-care facilities and family homes; providing administrative penalties. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
